Detailed Description

The main class that controls the entire forum and provides many useful utility functions. This is where the magic begins :).

Author:
Ryan LeFevre

Definition at line 10 of file osimo.class.php.

Member Function Documentation

Osimo ( $  options = false,
$  siteFolder = false 
)

Class constructor. All of the parameters are set in config.php

Parameters:
Array $options (optional) Array of options set in config.php.
String $siteFolder (optional) Site folder relative to the URL root set in config.php.

Definition at line 26 of file osimo.class.php.

init (  ) 

Due to PHP's instantiation method, this init function must be called after the Osimo object is created (which is done so in loader.php. This function instantiates all the other core objects required to make the forum run.

Definition at line 60 of file osimo.class.php.

requireGET ( $  id,
$  numeric = false,
$  redirect = 'index.php' 
)

Used to require the presence of specified GET variables and to check their data type if needed. If the GET variable is present, it is pulled into the scope of this class after the data checking is done.

Parameters:
String $id The name of the GET variable.
boolean $numeric (optional) Is this GET variable strictly a number?
String $redirect (optional) If GET variable is missing, where should we redirect? If false, then halt script execution.
Returns:
Boolean representing the validity of the GET variable.

Definition at line 129 of file osimo.class.php.

optionalGET ( $  id,
$  numeric = false 
)

Used to specify an optional GET variable while still doing data checking if needed. If the GET variable is present, it is pulled into the scope of this class after data checking is done.

Parameters:
String $id The name of the GET variable.
boolean $numeric (optional) Is this GET variable strictly a number?
Returns:
Boolean representing the presence and validity of the GET variable.

Definition at line 175 of file osimo.class.php.

requirePOST ( $  id,
$  numeric = false,
$  redirect = 'index.php' 
)

Used to require the presence of specified POST variables and to check their data type if needed. If the POST variable is present, it is pulled into the scope of this class after the data checking is done.

Parameters:
String $id The name of the POST variable.
boolean $numeric (optional) Is this POST variable strictly a number?
String $redirect (optional) If POST variable is missing, where should we redirect? If false, then halt script execution.
Returns:
Boolean representing the validity of the POST variable.

Definition at line 249 of file osimo.class.php.

options ( $  module  ) 

Used to pass options to modules.

This function is no longer in use by any Osimo module and will probably be removed in the near future. Instead, options are passed when the module is instantiated.

Parameters:
String $module

Definition at line 267 of file osimo.class.php.

Loads all of the required includes for all of the modules.

Parameters:
String $siteFolder

Definition at line 283 of file osimo.class.php.

category ( $  args = false  ) 

Dynamically loads an OsimoCategory object with the specified information.

See also:
OsimoCategory
Parameters:
Array $args (optional) All of the information pertaining to the category.
Returns:
new OsimoCategory object.

Definition at line 344 of file osimo.class.php.

globals ( $  name,
$  set = null 
)

A pseudo-global data manager, this function is most useful from within ajax-capabletheme files. Used to store data within the Osimo object that can be retrieved from anywhere without ambiguity or scope issues.

Parameters:
String $name The name/index to use for the data.
mixed $set (optional) If null, return the data at the specified index. Otherwise, set the data at the specified index to this value.
Returns:
The specified data (if retrieving)

Definition at line 377 of file osimo.class.php.

static validateOQLArgs ( $  args,
$  allowed,
$  escape = false 
) [static]

Used to validate the arguments used in an OQL statement. Returns the formatted OQL array.

Parameters:
String $args The arguments written in OQL format.
Array $allowed Which parameters are allowed to be set.
boolean $escape (optional) Whether or not the arguments should be escaped.
Returns:
The OQL formatted array.

Definition at line 403 of file osimo.class.php.

static getPageLimits ( $  page,
$  num 
) [static]

Utility function used to get the numbers for a SQL LIMIT clause in order to restrict data to a certain page i.e. page 4 of a thread only.

Parameters:
int $page The page number to be viewed.
int $num How many items there are per page.
Returns:
Array containing the SQL limits.
